title: Kakmakr
author: Kakmakr
content: I am very curious to know how people are playing Slots.Option A : Do you play one slot for a long time, until you hit the feature or until you win something big? Option B : Do you jump between different slots, play for a while and then jump to the next slot?Option C : Do you set a target amount for each Slot and then stay with that? I think people's success with slots might be linked to the way they are playing it, so for instance... people playing one slot until it pay out, might be more succesful, than the person that are jumping from one slot to the next.  What strategy do you think, will lead to the maximum profits? (Variance and RTP of each slot also determine the way that you are supposed to play on the different slots) Let's discuss.....

comments.author: Bitinity
comments.body: I choose the option B. I do not like to play 1 single slot for long period of time, I'll always have a limit of the time or based on how many spins I'll going to play in one slot game. I do not believe that the longer I play a single slot, it will give me higher chance to hit big multiplier. Quote from: Kakmakr on August 22, 2022, 12:50:53 PMWhat strategy do you think, will lead to the maximum profits? (Variance and RTP of each slot also determine the way that you are supposed to play on the different slots) Even though there is no single strategy works to maximize profit in slot game because it is pure luck based game but I like to play high-extreme volatility slots because my main purpose in playing slot is to get huge multiplier.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: Kakmakr on August 22, 2022, 12:50:53 PMWhat strategy do you think, will lead to the maximum profits? (Variance and RTP of each slot also determine the way that you are supposed to play on the different slots) This is a good point, my experience slots Basic capital strategy to determine victory, for sure, my betting options in the most appropriate slot games as you mentioned below.Quote from: Kakmakr on August 22, 2022, 12:50:53 PMOption B : Do you jump between different slots, play for a while and then jump to the next slot?That's the method I often do jumping from other slots to other slots, I managed to do that with a win, slot one didn't work, two were the same, third I won.Addition:However, in my experience the strategy for determining betting hours is also important points and assessments, I often place bets for slots around 04-05 in the morning, that's my trick to get good results.

comments.author: len01
comments.body: i chose option B.the reason is that i have a target from Slot 1 to Slot the second and so on. every time i play slot i have a target how much i should make from the first slot game.for example i enter into slot gambling first i make a bet 10x get $100 then i move to another slot gambling and aim to get the same result after that move to another slot.maybe my way many disagree but that's my way to get quick results and not really expect to get a big jackpot after spending a lot of time and money

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: Quote from: Kakmakr on August 22, 2022, 12:50:53 PMOption B : Do you jump between different slots, play for a while and then jump to the next slot?The same with the others, it's convenient to do this strategy. When you think that you're not getting any luck with the current slot that you play with, you just jump off with the other to test your luck, and so on and so forth. I guess there are slots players that are also jumping from one casino to the other casino if they're also not getting the luck that they're expecting because there's the belief that luck might be on the other casino.

comments.author: AbuBhakar
comments.body: I play 10 to 20 spin just to try my luck and when I didn’t hit something significant profit or a bonus then I resort on few bonus buy and leave when I get the profit on few tries. I really believe that gambling should be play quickly because of the house edge and human error. The more I play means the more I will lose because of increasing possible mistake by human error such as patience.There was a time that I’m playing slot and manage to spin more than 200 without getting anything and lose half of my bank roll. I got impatient and bet it all on my next spin which ended bust. After that, I never play slot slowly and I only play slot nowadays very seldom.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: Kakmakr on August 22, 2022, 12:50:53 PMI think people's success with slots might be linked to the way they are playing it, so for instance... people playing one slot until it pay out, might be more succesful, than the person that are jumping from one slot to the next.  Jumping around has helped no one even down to life choices, at every point making a decision and sticking with it to see the outcome has always been better than making a decision and then changing your mind over and over again, in this case, making a decision to play this slot game, then suddenly after a while deciding to play another in almost the same time frame.In my opinion, even if you choose to jump playing from on multiple slots, it will be more reasonable that you visited today and played this slot game and then you visited another day and played on another slots rather than jumping from one slots to another on the same day that you visited when there is nothing wrong.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: Quote from: Kakmakr on August 22, 2022, 12:50:53 PMI am very curious to know how people are playing Slots.Option A : Do you play one slot for a long time, until you hit the feature or until you win something big? This is me, expect the word hitting big I would include the term until I feel enough or exhausted the money.To be honest when I play slots I don't record the wins and loss but I will keep an eye on the history, if I see only the reds in the session then I postpone the bet as well.Slot is more fun which keep us on the edge while rolling that is the best part we as a common gambler has to experience not the RTP or returns.

comments.author: masulum
comments.body: I am a typical player who adopts A and B. Usually I will stay in one slot until I get a free spin or normal spin that can give me a win that I think is quite big from the base bet I made. After 2x free spins I get, mostly I will move to another game since after that little bit hard to get another free spins. For some occasions I set 200 spins for 1 game and move to other every 200 spins. But in my game, I'm more to type A.

comments.author: ryzaadit
comments.body: A: For the slot that keep hitting scatter even the result is bad or under more than 100x.B: If you get a bad section, especially for provider "Pragmatic & Play N Go" while you can easily have some average the slot from this provider can hitting scatter with estimation spin 100-120 spin. If more then 200 spin can't hitting any scatter, then changing the slot is the option.Pushing to much on the same slot, while you're not hitting anything with more than 300-500 spin is not good. You're gonna to getting triggered, lose from normal spin & decide to buy bonus feature + have a bad result after the buy feature.

comments.author: ralle14
comments.body: Quote from: Kakmakr on August 22, 2022, 12:50:53 PMWhat strategy do you think, will lead to the maximum profits? (Variance and RTP of each slot also determine the way that you are supposed to play on the different slots) I usually stick to one game that fits to my liking (on most of my sessions) so option A is what fits my playstyle but I also switch games when i'd have that bad feeling and expect it won't pay out something good this time so it's a mix between A and B.When it comes to profits these strategies seem like a hit or miss since they won't be effective most of the time but based on my luck i've had more success with option B (frequently switching games) when compared to option A.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: I'm with option C. I usually just have a set limit of budget on my gambling activities and never have I went over that in a long time. I also find it hard to jump from one slots game to another since I believe that you will eventually hit something in a single slot session if you stayed at it for a certain amount of time. I'm a huge believer of the 'hearsay' that slots are designed to give some wins after X amount of bets, so I just keep on playing until I exhaust my budget and when that time comes, I just get over the session and move on with other things that I'm doing.

comments.author: iv4n
comments.body: I am all three... sometimes I have long sessions, playing with some lower bets and chasing for some big payout in the bonus round, when and if that happens I move to another, and I will also move to another if a slot takes too much and I don't have a feeling that I will hit anything worthy!By jumper, I get it's when I don't have a lot of time so I just jump in and buy a few bonus rounds and hope for the best!I guess we all need that option C, but in my case, it's difficult in some moments, I just get too relaxed and I go over x3-x5 and I continue to gamble and lose a lot more than I won. Also, I get into some slots with too high expectations, I tend to rise bets and I end up losing a lot more than I wanted cause I had a "feeling". So targets are important in both directions, and when I stick with that I last long and I even collect some profit, but when I get too relaxed (which happens sometimes) in most cases it's a bad decision that leads to losing a lot of money!

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: Quote from: YOSHIE on August 22, 2022, 01:30:39 PM...Addition:However, in my experience the strategy for determining betting hours is also important points and assessments, I often place bets for slots around 04-05 in the morning, that's my trick to get good results.Yes I have read already one topic were there was such explanation but I have some doubts if you play online - international websites...because how you can start to gamble at 04-05 morning, which time zone you choose??Unfortunately I am not a slot player  and I cannot reply to this poll... I play normally  just few rolls (only free rolls  from wagering contest or other gifts by casinos)

comments.author: D ltr
comments.body: I chose option A because I'm the type of person who finds it difficult to switch to another game before the first game gets a win, maybe I'm the old-fashioned way or something but I feel comfortable with the way I play

comments.author: Doell
comments.body: When I start gambling slots, I jump from one slot to another. It really helps earn money, to be honest it's real. But when I've been playing for a long time with slots and only want to focus on one game then I just stay in there, actually it's bad because I often lose if only stuck to one game, in fact it will be addicting if only on one game. So I chose option B combined with C, set target amount and play slot jump will be more profitable.

comments.author: abel1337
comments.body: I don't play slots on a casino that much but I play somewhat the same as slots like on an arcade in my local place. I do like changing machines that's why I'm jumping out on different machine especially if I hit that jackpot since It's rare to get a jackpot on a second time. I think playing on a single slot for an extended period of time can cause boringness and unwillingness to play so I think jumping on different machine can reduce that since mechanics and animations are different and it can provide a good enough entertainment.

comments.author: darkangel11
comments.body: I don't play slots at all. When I tried a few times in my life it was very short because I lost all my money in a few rolls. I don't think I've ever had even 30% win ratio in slots it's literally the worst game for me. It's good to see some people have their lucky runs on these machines. Slots is also quite boring when compared with poker or blackjack. It lacks decision making which makes the game extremely repetitive.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: When I play at slots I stick to just one game. I also initiate my game with a stop loss limit in mind: if I lose determined amount of money I simply quit my session, although I don't have a plan to stop playing when winning. To know when to stop I simply use my intuition. After hiting a decent prize or a decent sequence of rewards, an alert lights in my conscience indicating it's time to stop because I've already made a lot of progress and profit compared to the initial bankroll. Once this happens it's time to leave because luck is tricky and can change suddenly on the next roll.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: Kakmakr on August 22, 2022, 12:50:53 PMI am very curious to know how people are playing Slots.Option A : Do you play one slot for a long time, until you hit the feature or until you win something big? Option B : Do you jump between different slots, play for a while and then jump to the next slot?Option C : Do you set a target amount for each Slot and then stay with that? I think people's success with slots might be linked to the way they are playing it, so for instance... people playing one slot until it pay out, might be more succesful, than the person that are jumping from one slot to the next.  What strategy do you think, will lead to the maximum profits? (Variance and RTP of each slot also determine the way that you are supposed to play on the different slots) Let's discuss.....   Usually I played the same slot. Constantly. I didn't see the point in playing different slots, because I think that all the same, but with a different outer wrapper. I chose the one I like and played until the last time I lost my entire deposit. So, I choose Option C - play one slot until winning loss. Your theory that playing one slot can be more successful than constantly changing slot games turned out to be wrong in my case. I believe that the strategy of ignoring gambling will lead to maximum profit (keeping your money), because playing in a casino is the way to enrich their owners, not you.
